For example, if sender's burnToken balance or approved allowance to this contract is less than `amount`. - burn() reverts. For example, if `amount` is 0. - maxFee is greater than or equal to `amount`. - maxFee is less than `amount * minFee / MIN_FEE_MULTIPLIER`. - MessageTransmitterV2#sendMessage reverts.","params":{"amount":"amount of tokens to burn","burnToken":"token to burn `amount` of, on local domain","destinationCaller":"authorized caller on the destination domain, as bytes32. For example, if sender's burnToken balance or approved allowance to this contract is less than `amount`. - burn() reverts. For example, if `amount` is 0. - maxFee is greater than or equal to `amount`. - maxFee is less than `amount * minFee / MIN_FEE_MULTIPLIER`. - MessageTransmitterV2#sendMessage reverts.","params":{"amount":"amount of tokens to burn","burnToken":"token to burn `amount` of, on local domain","destinationCaller":"authorized caller on the destination domain, as bytes32. acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

addLocalMinter(address).details: Reverts if a minter is already set for the local domain.

params.newLocalMinter: The address of the minter on the local domain.

addRemoteTokenMessenger(uint32,bytes32).details: Reverts if there is already a TokenMessenger set for domain.

params.tokenMessenger: Address of remote TokenMessenger as bytes32.

params.account: Address to add to the denylist

depositForBurn(uint256,uint32,bytes32,ad.details: reverts if: - given burnToken is not supported - given destinationDomain has no TokenMessenger registered - transferFrom() reverts. For example, if sender's burnToken balance or approved allowance to this contract is less than `amount`. - burn() reverts. For example, if `amount` is 0. - maxFee is greater than or equal to `amount`. - maxFee is less than `amount * minFee / MIN_FEE_MULTIPLIER`. - MessageTransmitterV2#sendMessage reverts.

params.burnToken: token to burn `amount` of, on local domain
params.destinationCaller: authorized caller on the destination domain, as bytes32. If equal to bytes32(0), any address can broadcast the message.
params.destinationDomain: destination domain to receive message on
params.maxFee: maximum fee to pay on the destination domain, specified in units of burnToken
params.minFinalityThreshold: the minimum finality at which a burn message will be attested to.
params.mintRecipient: address of mint recipient on destination domain

depositForBurnWithHook(uint256,uint32,by.details: reverts if: - `hookData` is zero-length - `burnToken` is not supported - `destinationDomain` has no TokenMessenger registered - transferFrom() reverts. For example, if sender's burnToken balance or approved allowance to this contract is less than `amount`. - burn() reverts. For example, if `amount` is 0. - maxFee is greater than or equal to `amount`. - maxFee is less than `amount * minFee / MIN_FEE_MULTIPLIER`. - MessageTransmitterV2#sendMessage reverts.

params.burnToken: token to burn `amount` of, on local domain
params.destinationCaller: authorized caller on the destination domain, as bytes32. If equal to bytes32(0), any address can broadcast the message.
params.destinationDomain: destination domain to receive message on
params.hookData: hook data to append to burn message for interpretation on destination domain
params.maxFee: maximum fee to pay on the destination domain, specified in units of burnToken
params.mintRecipient: address of mint recipient on destination domain, as bytes32

params.amount: The amount for which to calculate the minimum fee

returns._0: The minimum fee for the given amount

handleReceiveFinalizedMessage(uint32,byt.details: Validates the local sender is the local MessageTransmitter, and the remote sender is a registered remote TokenMessenger for `remoteDomain`.

params.remoteDomain: The domain where the message originated from.
params.sender: The sender of the message (remote TokenMessenger).

handleReceiveUnfinalizedMessage(uint32,b.details: Validates the local sender is the local MessageTransmitter, and the remote sender is a registered remote TokenMessenger for `remoteDomain`.Validates that `finalityThresholdExecuted` is at least 500.

params.finalityThresholdExecuted: The level of finality at which the message was attested to
params.remoteDomain: The domain where the message originated from.
params.sender: The sender of the message (remote TokenMessenger).

initialize((address,address,address,addr.details: Reverts if any of the roles are the zero addressReverts if `remoteDomains_` and `remoteTokenMessengers_` are unequal lengthEach remoteTokenMessenger address must correspond to the remote domain at the same index in respective arrays.Reverts if any `remoteTokenMessengers_` entry equals bytes32(0)

params.remoteDomains_: Array of remote domains to configure
params.remoteTokenMessengers_: Array of remote token messenger addresses

returns._0: True if the account is on the deny list and false if the account is not.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

removeLocalMinter().details: Reverts if the minter of the local domain is not set.

removeRemoteTokenMessenger(uint32).details: Reverts if there is no TokenMessenger set for `domain`.

setFeeRecipient(address).details: Reverts if not called by the ownerReverts if `_feeRecipient` is the zero address

setMinFee(uint256).details: Reverts if not called by the min fee controllerReverts if the minimum fee is equal to or greater than MIN_FEE_MULTIPLIER

setMinFeeController(address).details: Reverts if not called by the ownerReverts if `_minFeeController` is the zero address

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

params.account: Address to remove from the denylist

updateDenylister(address).details: Reverts if not called by the OwnerReverts if the new denylister address is the zero address

addLocalMinter(address).notice: Add minter for the local domain.

addRemoteTokenMessenger(uint32,bytes32).notice: Add the TokenMessenger for a remote domain.

denylist(address).notice: Adds an address to the denylist

depositForBurn(uint256,uint32,bytes32,ad.notice: Deposits and burns tokens from sender to be minted on destination domain. Emits a `DepositForBurn` event.

depositForBurnWithHook(uint256,uint32,by.notice: Deposits and burns tokens from sender to be minted on destination domain. Emits a `DepositForBurn` event.

getMinFeeAmount(uint256).notice: Returns the minimum fee for a given amount

handleReceiveFinalizedMessage(uint32,byt.notice: Handles an incoming finalized message received by the local MessageTransmitter, and takes the appropriate action. For a burn message, mints the associated token to the requested recipient on the local domain.

handleReceiveUnfinalizedMessage(uint32,b.notice: Handles an incoming unfinalized message received by the local MessageTransmitter, and takes the appropriate action. For a burn message, mints the associated token to the requested recipient on the local domain, less fees. Fees are separately minted to the currently set `feeRecipient` address.

isDenylisted(address).notice: Returns whether an address is currently on the denylist

removeLocalMinter().notice: Remove the minter for the local domain.

removeRemoteTokenMessenger(uint32).notice: Remove the TokenMessenger for a remote domain.

rescueERC20(address,address,uint256).notice: Rescue ERC20 tokens locked up in this contract.

setMinFee(uint256).notice: Sets the minimum fee for all transfers in 1/1000 basis points

setMinFeeController(address).notice: Sets the minimum fee controller address

unDenylist(address).notice: Removes an address from the denylist

updateRescuer(address).notice: Assign the rescuer role to a given address.
